name: Tim McGraw's "Last Dollar (Fly Away)" Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: What fits in the blank? '1, 2, 3 like a bird I _____'.
questions.explanation:
sing.

	This song has been made into a ringtone for your cell phone.  "Last Dollar" made it to the Billboard Hot Country Songs number-one singles in 2007.

questions.text: At the very end of the song, who aids Tim McGraw in singing?
questions.explanation:
his daughters only.

	At the end of the song, his daughters sing along with him.  His wife does not sing with him or his daughters.  His daughters' names are Gracie Katherine, Audrey Caroline, and Maggie Elizabeth.  His wife's name is Faith Hill.

questions.text: What fills this blank?  'I'm down to my last dollar.  I've walked right through my shoes.  It's just a small reminder of the hell that I've gone through.  But look at me still smiling, I'm wondering what I'll do, _________________________________'.
questions.correct: Cause since I ain't got nothin' I got nothing to lose
options: Cause since I ain't got nothin' I got nothing to do
Cause since I have nothin' I got nothing to do
Cause since I have nothin' I got nothing to lose
questions.explanation:
Cause since I ain't got nothin' I got nothing to lose.

	This song was released on January 13, 2007.  The album wasn't released until March 27 of that same year.  McGraw's real name is Samuel Timothy McGraw, but he goes by Tim McGraw.  He was born on May 1, 1967.

questions.text: In the music video, what other country star do we see, other than his wife?
questions.explanation:
Reba McEntire.

	In the music video of "Last Dollar (Fly Away)," we have an extremely brief view of him and Reba McEntire.  We see her hugging Tim McGraw during a concert.  Kenny Chesney, George Strait, and Martina McBride did not appear in this video.

questions.text: Fill in the blank.  'Look at me so free, nothin's holdin' me down, (down).  Look at me so free, _____________________!'
questions.correct: Can't keep my feet on the ground
options: Can't keep my feet on the ground (ground)
Can't keep my feet on all the ground (ground)
Can't keep my feet on all the ground
questions.explanation:
Can't keep my feet on the ground.

	'Let it Go' made it to number 1 in the top 200 rated albums, making it the fourth album making it to number 1.  It also made it his ninth album to make it to number 1 in the top country albums.  Tim McGraw is an actor, as well.  His first television appearance was on 'The Jeff Foxworthy Show', playing as his rival.

questions.text: On which album did "Last Dollar (Fly Away)" first appear?
options: Tim McGraw Reflected: Greatest Hits No. 2
questions.explanation:
Let it Go.

	"Last Dollar (Fly Away)" was released on his 2007 album, 'Let it Go'.  'Live Like You Were Dying' was released in 2004.  His 'Greatest Hits' was released in 2000 and his second greatest hits album was released in 2006.

questions.text: Who has not played electric guitar for Tim McGraw's band?
questions.explanation:
Billy Mason.

	Billy Mason plays Drums and Percussion.  Darran Smith is on electric and acoustic guitar.  Denny Hemingson is on electric and acoustic guitar and steal guitar, dobro, baritone guitar, and the slide guitar.  Bob Miner is on both electric and acoustic guitar, and also on mandolin and the banjo.

questions.text: Who originally wrote this song in 2002?
questions.explanation:
Big Kenny.

	Big Kenny, who is Big from Big & Rich, originally wrote the song.  He wrote it after losing all his money in a blackjack game in Las Vegas.  Later on he sang it for Tim McGraw, and Tim looked at him and said, "Are you going to let me record that?"  This is how Tim McGraw ended up singing this song.

questions.text: Has "Last Dollar (Fly Away)" even been in the US Hot 100?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	On April 7th, 2007, "Last Dollar (Fly Away)" was #81 on the list.  About a week later, it sky rocketed all the way to #13!  But one week later, it fell only another 4 spots down to #17.

questions.text: Which of these did not appear on his album that "Last Dollar (Fly Away)" was first released in?
questions.explanation:
Something Like That.

	There are 13 songs on this album, including both "Last Dollar (Fly Away)" and "Let it Go".  "I'm Workin'", "Whiskey and You", "Suspicions", "Kristofferson", "Put Your Loving on Me", "Nothin' to Die For", "River and Me", "Train #10", "I Need You", "Comin' Home", and "Shotgun Rider" are the 11 other songs on his 2007 album, "Let it Go".
